result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney M Chapman

records.addlTxt:
8:26 AM Defendant Courtney M Chapman in court.  Attorney Justin Griffis in court for Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. for Courtney M Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. The State is asking for an adjournment as their witness is not available today. Attorney Griffis does not object to the State's request. The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/6/2022 from defendant requesting a bail reduction.
**Clerk notes that cash bond was posted on 10/6/2022. No further action needed.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

4:08 PM Defendant Courtney M Chapman in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Courtney M Chapman. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Riederer.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Miller states attorney Andrew Herbers represents the defendant on her other matters and will be appointed to this case as well.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  The Court notes it is not addressing WCS issues, but notes this might be addressed by the Trial Court.  If the defendant is not complying with WCS in the other matters, the Court informs defendant a warrant will be issued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
